localhost.controllers

Class UserController

  • java.lang.Object
    • localhost.controllers.BaseController
      • localhost.controllers.UserController

  • public final class UserController
extends BaseController
    This class lists all the endpoints of the groups.

    • Method Detail

      • getUser

        public UserResponse getUser(String name,
                            String id)
                     throws ApiException,
                            IOException
        To get the details of a specific user account by username or user id, use this endpoint. At Least one value is needed. When both are given,then user id will be considered to fetch user information.
        Parameters:
        name - Optional parameter: Username of the user that you want to query
        id - Optional parameter: The GUID of the user account to query
        Returns:
        Returns the UserResponse response from the API call
        Throws:
        ApiException - Represents error response from the server.
        IOException - Signals that an I/O exception of some sort has occurred.

      • createUser

        public UserResponse createUser(TspublicRestV2UserCreateRequest body)
                        throws ApiException,
                               IOException
        To programmatically create a user account in the ThoughtSpot system, use this API endpoint. Using this API, you can create a user and assign groups. To create a user, you require admin user privileges. All users created in the ThoughtSpot system are added to ALL_GROUP.
        Parameters:
        body - Required parameter: Example:
        Returns:
        Returns the UserResponse response from the API call
        Throws:
        ApiException - Represents error response from the server.
        IOException - Signals that an I/O exception of some sort has occurred.

        Returns:
        Returns the UserResponse response from the API call

      • updateUser

        public Boolean updateUser(TspublicRestV2UserUpdateRequest body)
                   throws ApiException,
                          IOException
        You can use this endpoint to programmatically modify an existing user account. To modify a user, you require admin user privileges. At least one of User Id or username is mandatory. When both are given, then user id will be considered and username will be updated.
        Parameters:
        body - Required parameter: Example:
        Returns:
        Returns the Boolean response from the API call
        Throws:
        ApiException - Represents error response from the server.
        IOException - Signals that an I/O exception of some sort has occurred.

      • deleteUser

        public Boolean deleteUser(String name,
                          String id)
                   throws ApiException,
                          IOException
        To remove a user from the ThoughtSpot system, use this endpoint. At least one value is needed. When both are given, then user id will be considered to delete user.
        Parameters:
        name - Optional parameter: Username of the user account
        id - Optional parameter: The GUID of the user account
        Returns:
        Returns the Boolean response from the API call
        Throws:
        ApiException - Represents error response from the server.
        IOException - Signals that an I/O exception of some sort has occurred.

      • addGroupsToUser

        public Boolean addGroupsToUser(TspublicRestV2UserAddgroupRequest body)
                        throws ApiException,
                               IOException
        To programmatically add groups to an existing ThoughtSpot user, use this endpoint. When you assign groups to a user, the user inherits the privileges assigned to those groups. At least one of user Id or username is mandatory. When both are given, then user id will be considered.
        Parameters:
        body - Required parameter: Example:
        Returns:
        Returns the Boolean response from the API call
        Throws:
        ApiException - Represents error response from the server.
        IOException - Signals that an I/O exception of some sort has occurred.

      • addGroupsToUserAsync

        public CompletableFuture<Boolean> addGroupsToUserAsync(TspublicRestV2UserAddgroupRequest body)
        To programmatically add groups to an existing ThoughtSpot user, use this endpoint. When you assign groups to a user, the user inherits the privileges assigned to those groups. At least one of user Id or username is mandatory. When both are given, then user id will be considered.
        Parameters:
        body - Required parameter: Example:
        Returns:
        Returns the Boolean response from the API call

      • removeGroupsFromUser

        public Boolean removeGroupsFromUser(TspublicRestV2UserRemovegroupRequest body)
                             throws ApiException,
                                    IOException
        To programmatically remove groups from an existing ThoughtSpot user, use this API endpoint. The API removes only the user association. It does not delete the user or group from the Thoughtspot system. At least one of user id or username is mandatory. When both are given, then user id will be considered.
        Parameters:
        body - Required parameter: Example:
        Returns:
        Returns the Boolean response from the API call
        Throws:
        ApiException - Represents error response from the server.
        IOException - Signals that an I/O exception of some sort has occurred.

      • removeGroupsFromUserAsync

        public CompletableFuture<Boolean> removeGroupsFromUserAsync(TspublicRestV2UserRemovegroupRequest body)
        To programmatically remove groups from an existing ThoughtSpot user, use this API endpoint. The API removes only the user association. It does not delete the user or group from the Thoughtspot system. At least one of user id or username is mandatory. When both are given, then user id will be considered.
        Parameters:
        body - Required parameter: Example:
        Returns:
        Returns the Boolean response from the API call

      • searchUsers

        public List<UserResponse> searchUsers(TspublicRestV2UserSearchRequest body)
                               throws ApiException,
                                      IOException
        To get the details of a specific user account or all users in the ThoughtSpot system, use this endpoint. If no input is provided, then all user are included in the response.
        Parameters:
        body - Required parameter: Example:
        Returns:
        Returns the List of UserResponse response from the API call
        Throws:
        ApiException - Represents error response from the server.
        IOException - Signals that an I/O exception of some sort has occurred.
